sen.j: 当麻蹴速（たいまのけはや）は、日本神話に登場する人物。
sen.e: TAIMA no Kehaya is a personality that appears in Japanese myths.
TAIMA no Kehaya is a person that appears in Japanese myths.
sen.cmt: personality >> person と修正します。
sen.e: TAIMA no Kehaya is a person that appears in Japanese myths.
God of Sumo.
God of Sumo.
God of Sumo.

sen.j: 開化天皇の系統の皇族である小俣王（こまたのおう、当麻勾君（たいまのまがりのきみ）の祖）の血を引く垂仁天皇の時代の人。
sen.e: He is a personality in the Emperor Suisin era, who is a descendent of Komata no O (ancestor of Taima no Magarinokimi) from imperial family of the lineage of Emperor Kaika.
He is a person in the Emperor Suisin era, who is a descendent of Komata no O (ancestor of Taima no Magarinokimi) who was the member of Imperial family from the lineage of Emperor Kaika.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。From・・・ を who was the member of Imperial family from the lineage of Emperor Kaika と修正しました。
sen.e: He is a person in the Emperor Suisin era, who is a descendent of Komata no O (ancestor of Taima no Magarinokimi) who was the member of Imperial family from the lineage of Emperor Kaika.

sen.j: 名前から、蹴り技の名手と言われる。
sen.e: He is said to be a master of kicks by his name.
He is said to be a master of kicks by his name.
He is said to be a master of kicks by his name.

sen.j: 大和国の当麻邑（たいまのむら）に住み、強力を誇って「ひたぶるに生死を問わず力比べせむ」と闘争を欲していた。
sen.e: Although he, who lived in Taema town of Yamato-no-kuni, was proud of his gouriki and was seeking for fights saying "Measure my strength without questioning life entirely", he faced with NOMI no Sukune of Izumo Province by sumo wrestling by Emperor Suisin's order and he is said to break his back by being trampled after kicking to each other.
He, who lived in Taima Villege of Yamato-no-kuni, was proud of his great physical strength and was seeking for fights saying "Measure my strength without questioning life entirely".
sen.cmt: 「強力」をgourikiとする必要はなく、またローマ字読みだけでは意味が分からないので、単に「great physical strength」とします。「当麻」の読みは、原文にあるように「たいま」とし、Taima Villegeと訳します。一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He, who lived in Taima Villege of Yamato-no-kuni, was proud of his great physical strength and was seeking for fights saying "Measure my strength without questioning life entirely".

sen.j: しかし、垂仁天皇の命により出雲国の野見宿禰と角力（角の字は手偏に角と書く）で対戦することになり、互いに蹴り合った後に、腰を踏み折られたという。
sen.e: However he played sumo wrestling against NOMI no Sukune of Izumo Province by Emperor Suisin's order and he is said to break his back by being trampled, after kicking each other in the match.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処書き換えました。
sen.e: However, it is said that he played sumo wrestling with NOMI no Sukune from Izumo Province by Emperor Suisin's order and that his back was broken by being trampled, after kicking each other in the match.

sen.j: 当麻蹴速の土地は没収されて、勝者の野見宿禰の土地となる。
sen.e: TAIMA no Kehaya's land was confiscated and became that of the winner, NOMI no Sukune.
TAIMA no Kehaya's land was confiscated and became that of the winner, NOMI no Sukune.
TAIMA no Kehaya's land was confiscated and became that of the winner, NOMI no Sukune.

sen.j: 穴師坐兵主神社（奈良県桜井市）摂社の相撲神社に、野見宿禰とともに祀られている。
sen.e: He is enshrined in the sumo shrine of Anashinimasuhyozu-jinja Shrine(Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture), along with NOMI no Sukune.
He is enshrined in the Sumo-jinja Shrine that is an auxiliary shrine of Anashinimasuhyozu-jinja Shrine (Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture), along with NOMI no Sukune.
sen.cmt: スペースを加えました。「摂社の」が訳漏れです。「相撲神社」をSumo-jinja Shrineと修正しました。
sen.e: He is enshrined in the Sumo-jinja Shrine that is an auxiliary shrine of Anashinimasuhyozu-jinja Shrine (Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture), along with NOMI no Sukune.
